translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The seventh section
Discussion of the ripening of the noble Dhamma
“Is there no ripening of the noble Dhamma?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: nanu mahat phalam sāmaññam mahat phalam brahmaññanti
translated: “But isn’t the life of one who is a contemplative, the life of one who is a brahmin, fruitful?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci mahapphalaṁ sāmaññaṁ mahapphalaṁ brahmaññaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci mahat phalam sāmaññam mahat phalam brahmañña no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then you shouldn’t say that there is no ripening of the noble Dhamma.”
“Is there no ripening of the noble Dhamma?”
“Yes.”
“But isn’t there the fruit of stream-entry?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi sotāpattiphalaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi sotāpatti phala no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: natthi ariya dhamma vipāko ti  nanu atthi sakadāgāmi phalam pe  anāgāmi phalam pe
translated: “Then you shouldn’t say that there is no ripening of the noble Dhamma.”
“Isn’t there the fruit of once-returning … the fruit of non-returning … the fruit of arahantship?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi arahattaphalaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi arahatta phala no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then you shouldn’t say that there is no ripening of the noble Dhamma.”
“Is the fruit of stream-entry not a ripening?”

analyzed: āmantā  dāna phalam na  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Is the fruit of giving not a ripening?”🔽“No.”
“Then you shouldn’t say that the fruit of stream-entry is not a ripening.”
“Yes.”
“Is the fruit of virtue …
the fruit of development not a result?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the fruit of once-returning …
the fruit of non-returning …
the fruit of arahantship not a result?”
“Yes.”
“Is the fruit of giving not a result?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the fruit of arahantship not a result?”
“Yes.”
“Is the fruit of virtue …
the fruit of development not a result?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the fruit of giving a result?”
“Yes.”
“Is the fruit of stream-entry a result?”
“Is it so that one who is not a trainee is not a person who has entered upon the way?” …
“Is the fruit of giving a result?”
“Yes.”
“Is the fruit of once-returning …
the fruit of non-returning …
the fruit of arahantship a result?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the fruit of virtue …
the fruit of development a result?”
“Yes.”
“Is the fruit of stream-entry a result?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the fruit of development a result?”
“Yes.”
“Is the fruit of once-returning …
the fruit of non-returning …
the fruit of arahantship a result?”
“You shouldn’t say that.”
“Is what is wholesome in the sense-sphere connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“Yes.”
“Is what is wholesome in the supramundane connected with resultant-consciousness?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  rūpāvacaram kusalam pe
translated: “You shouldn’t say that.”🔽“Is what is wholesome in the fine-material connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“Is what is wholesome in the immaterial connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“Yes.”
“Is what is wholesome in the supramundane connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“You shouldn’t say that.”
“Is what is wholesome in the supramundane not connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“Yes.”
“Is what is wholesome in the sense-sphere not connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“You shouldn’t say that.”
“Is what is wholesome in the supramundane not connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“Yes.”
“Is what is wholesome in the fine-material …
in the immaterial not connected with resultant-consciousness?”
“You shouldn’t say that.”

analyzed: kāmāvacaram kusalam sa vipākam ācaya gāmi iti
translated: “Is what is wholesome in the sense-sphere connected with resultant-consciousness and is it of increase?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: lokuttaram kusalam sa vipākam ācaya gāmi iti
translated: “Is what is wholesome in the supramundane connected with resultant-consciousness and is it of increase?”
“You shouldn’t say that.”
“Is what is wholesome in the fine-material …

analyzed: arūpāvacaram kusalam sa vipākam ācaya gāmi iti
translated: in the immaterial connected with resultant-consciousness and is it of increase?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: lokuttaram kusalam sa vipākam ācaya gāmi iti
translated: “Is what is wholesome in the supramundane connected with resultant-consciousness and is it of increase?”
“That can’t be said.”

analyzed: lokuttaram kusalam sa vipākam apacaya gāmi iti
translated: “Is what is supramundane, wholesome, and has results subject to decline?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: kāmāvacaram kusalam sa vipākam apacaya gāmi iti
translated: “Is what is in the sense-sphere, wholesome, and has results subject to decline?”
“That can’t be said.”

analyzed: lokuttaram kusalam sa vipākam apacaya gāmi iti
translated: “Is what is supramundane, wholesome, and has results subject to decline?”
“Yes.”
“Is what is in the fine-material sphere …

analyzed: arūpāvacaram kusalam sa vipākam apacaya gāmi iti
translated: in the immaterial sphere, wholesome, and has results subject to decline?”
“That can’t be said.”
The discussion of the results of noble qualities is finished.
